title: Cape hanger

properties.name: description
properties.value: The cape hanger can be built in the display space of the achievement gallery in a player-owned house. It requires 80 Construction to build and when built, it gives 800 experience. The player must have a hammer and a saw in their inventory to build it.

content:
Cape hanger
Icon
Furniture nameCape hanger
Released25 August 2016 (Update)
Level80
Experience800 xp
RoomAchievement Gallery
HotspotDisplay space
FlatpackableNo
ExamineYou could display a prestigious cape here.
Advanced data
Object ID29166
Icon Item ID20632

The cape hanger can be built in the display space of the achievement gallery in a player-owned house. It requires 80 Construction to build and when built, it gives 800 experience. The player must have a hammer and a saw in their inventory to build it.

Players can use either a mythical cape, champion's cape, fire cape, infernal cape, capes obtained from Captain Rimor, or any cape of accomplishment (max cape variants can be used too) on the cape hanger to display it. One cape can be displayed at a time. The display can be admired, making the player perform the same animation as praying at an altar.

A player will need both the hood and the skillcape in order for it to be displayed. In addition, untrimmed skillcapes that are mounted on the cape hanger will become trimmed upon achieving level 99 in another skill.

If a player displays one of a certain set of capes of accomplishment or a mythical cape, the cape's right-click perks become available only to the house owner.[clarification needed] Passive perks are not available, for example a player can not use grimy herbs on vials of water without having a herblore cape equipped. The right-click perks of the following skillcapes can be used while displayed on the cape hanger:

Capes
Construction Crafting Farming
Fishing Fletching Herblore
Hunter Magic Strength
Quest point Achievement diary Music
Max -

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Capes hung on the rack are noticeably brighter compared to those worn by players. This is due to the game's graphics having all characters being lit from the front, with the back of all characters appearing shadowed. This shadowing causes the darkening and desaturation of items on a player's back.
  • Before an update on an unknown date, mounted max cape variants did not display the hood despite requiring the corresponding max hoods.

The '''cape hanger''' can be built in the [[display space]] of the [[achievement gallery]] in a [[player-owned house]]. It requires 80 [[Construction]] to build and when built, it gives 800 [[experience]]. The player must have a [[hammer]] and a [[saw]] in their inventory to build it.

Players can use either a [[mythical cape]], [[champion's cape]], [[fire cape]], [[infernal cape]], capes obtained from [[Captain Rimor]], or any [[Cape of Accomplishment|cape of accomplishment]] ([[max cape]] variants can be used too) on the cape hanger to display it. One cape can be displayed at a time. The display can be admired, making the player perform the same animation as praying at an altar.

A player will need both the hood '''and''' the skillcape in order for it to be displayed. In addition, untrimmed skillcapes that are mounted on the cape hanger '''will become trimmed''' upon achieving level 99 in another skill.

If a player displays one of a certain set of capes of accomplishment or a mythical cape, the cape's right-click [[Skillcape#Perks|perks]] become available '''only to the house owner'''.{{clarify|This sentence, and the paragraph as a whole, is very unclear as to what it means and how it works.}} Passive perks are '''not''' available, for example a player can not use grimy herbs on vials of water without having a [[herblore cape]] equipped. The right-click perks of the following skillcapes can be used while displayed on the cape hanger:

==Trivia==
*Capes hung on the rack are noticeably brighter compared to those worn by players. This is due to the game's graphics having all characters being lit from the front, with the back of all characters appearing shadowed. This shadowing causes the darkening and desaturation of items on a player's back.
*Before an update on an unknown date, mounted [[max cape]] variants did not display the hood despite requiring the corresponding [[max hood]]s.

{{Achievement gallery}}
